intro: Streptanthus squamiformis, commonly known as the squamose stalked crucifer, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar plants such as cabbages and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
